alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:26PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dolores, or 39 miles west of Durango, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties, including the following locations... Lebanon, Arriola and Lewis. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 28 and 41. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
